justification: Recognizes Team B’s taste for upside, but ignores that B trusts established talent and likes buying (not selling) injured stars—making trading away Tyler Anderson unlikely. Fails to consider Team A’s conservative preference for workhorse RBs; A gives up a healthy Tier 1 RB for two injured pieces. Claims Liam Adams can backfill an elite TE is incoherent. Rationale is generic and thin on roster/context specifics.
